citing_paper_authors: Albert, Gatt | Ehud, Reiter
raw_text: Over the past several years, a significant consensus has emerged over the definition of the realisation task, through the development of realisers such asREALPRO (Lavoie and Rambow, 1997), ALETH GEN (Coch, 1996), KPML (Bateman, 1997), FUF/SURGE (Elhadad and Robin, 1996), HALO GEN (Langkilde, 2000), YAG (McRoy et al, 2000), and OPENCCG (White, 2006) .Realisation involves two logically distinguish able tasks
clean_text: Over the past several years, a significant consensus has emerged over the definition of the realisation task, through the development of realisers such as REALPRO (Lavoie and Rambow, 1997), ALETH GEN (Coch, 1996), KPML (Bateman, 1997), FUF/SURGE (Elhadad and Robin, 1996), HALO GEN (Langkilde, 2000), YAG (McRoy et al, 2000), and OPENCCG (White, 2006). Realisation involves two logically distinguishable tasks.
